arm_group.description: Participants received 600 mg of oral N-acetylcysteine BID for 12 months.
Placebo was administered oral tablet BID for 12 months.

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: To evaluate whether long-term oral N-acetylcysteine ​​as an expectorant drug can
      reduce the frequency of acute exacerbations of patients with non-cystic fibrosis
      bronchiectasis and improve their quality of life.

      Methods: Patients with non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis will be randomly assigned to the
      observer group (participants receive 600 mg of oral N-acetylcysteine BID for 12 months) or
      the control group (participants receive oral tablet BID for 12 months). The primary endpoint
      was the frequency of acute exacerbations.

      Expected results: Compared with the control group, the frequency of acute exacerbations of
      the observer Group will decrease significantly.

      Hypothesis: Long-term oral N-acetylcysteine can reduce the frequency of acute exacerbations
      of patients with non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis and improve their quality of life.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized, Controlled Study of Long-term Oral N-Acetylcysteine ​​in Patients With Non-Cystic Fibrosis Bronchiectasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female study subjects ≥18 years of age and ≤80 years of age;

          -  Confirmed diagnosis of idiopathic bronchiectasis or postinfectious bronchiectasis

          -  Stable Bronchiectasis

          -  One month later after the acute exacerbation of bronchiectasis

          -  There are more than 2 times exacerbations of bronchiectasis during one year before
             enrollment.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Bronchiectasis due to special causes

          -  Smokers

          -  Are associated with bronchial asthma

          -  Have any serious or active medical or psychiatric illness.

intervention.description: 600mg po twice a day for 12 months
Oral tablet po twice a day for 12 months

clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Controlled Study of the Effects of Long-term Oral N-Acetylcysteine on Stable Non-Cystic Fibrosis Bronchiectasis

primary_outcome.description: An exacerbation of bronchiectasis is defined as either a change in one or more of the common symptoms of bronchiectasis (sputum volume or purulence, dyspnea, cough, and fatigue/malaise) or the onset of new symptoms (fever, pleurisy, haemoptysis or need for antibiotic treatment).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Assessment Test (CAT)
Change in forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) (Percent of Predicted for Age)
Forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) (L)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
